Metadata.title: Threat Analyzer - FSTEC Information Security Threat Analysis
Metadata.description: Information security threat analysis system in accordance with FSTEC Russia requirements

HomePage.description: The information security threat analysis system allows you to analyze threats, protection measures, and tactical tasks in accordance with FSTEC Russia requirements. Choose one of the available work scenarios to begin analysis.

analysisCard.title: Threat Analysis
analysisCard.description: Filter and search threats by various criteria with detailed analysis capabilities

threatsCard.description: View the complete list of information security threats with search and filtering capabilities

tasksCard.description: Tactical tasks from the MITRE ATT&CK model related to security threats

analyticsCard.title: Analytics and Charts
analyticsCard.description: Data visualization on information security threats helps to better understand threat distribution, identify the most active violators and vulnerable objects, and assess the effectiveness of protection measures.
analyticsCard.mitreAndMeasuresDesc: Connection between threats, tactics, and protection

dataSourcesCard.title: Data Sources
dataSourcesCard.clickableData: All data in the system is clickable — you can navigate to detailed information about threats, protection measures, and tactical tasks.
dataSourcesCard.dataActuality: Data is current as of the last threat database update

HelpDialog.title: System Help
HelpDialog.description: Information about the information security threat analysis system
HelpDialog.aboutDescription: Threat Analyzer is a system for analyzing information security threats in accordance with FSTEC Russia requirements. The system allows you to:
HelpDialog.aboutFeature3: Research tactical tasks from the MITRE ATT&CK model
HelpDialog.aboutFeature4: Visualize data through charts and diagrams
HelpDialog.aboutFeature5: Filter and search threats by various criteria
HelpDialog.threatsDesc: Potential actions by violators that may lead to information security breaches. Each threat is characterized by aspects of the CIA triad (Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability), threat sources, and impact objects.
HelpDialog.ciaDesc: Information security model including three aspects:
HelpDialog.availability: Availability — ensuring access to information when needed
HelpDialog.measuresDesc: Information protection measures defined in accordance with FSTEC Russia Order dated February 11, 2013 N 17. Each protection measure is linked to the threats it helps prevent.
HelpDialog.tasksDesc: Tactical tasks from the MITRE ATT&CK model that describe techniques and tactics used by violators. Related to information security threats.
HelpDialog.analysisSectionDesc: Filter and search threats by various criteria: tactical tasks, violators, impact objects, CIA triad aspects, and protection measures.
HelpDialog.threatsSectionDesc: View the complete list of information security threats with search, filtering, and detailed information navigation capabilities.
HelpDialog.measuresSectionDesc: List of information protection measures in accordance with FSTEC Order №17. Each measure contains an identifier and description.
HelpDialog.tasksSectionDesc: Tactical tasks from the MITRE ATT&CK model related to information security threats.
HelpDialog.chartsSectionDesc: Data visualization: CIA triad threat distribution, CIA combinations, top violators and objects, statistics on protection measures and tactical tasks.
HelpDialog.tip1: All interface elements are clickable — use them for navigation
HelpDialog.tip2: Filters can be combined for precise threat search
HelpDialog.tip3: Charts are interactive — hover for detailed information
HelpDialog.tip4: Use search to quickly find needed elements
HelpDialog.tip5: Switch themes for comfortable work at any time of day
HelpDialog.tip6: On detail view pages, you can navigate to related entities
HelpDialog.tip7: Use keyboard shortcuts for quick navigation (see KEYBOARD_SHORTCUTS.md)
HelpDialog.faq1Q: How to find a threat by a specific violator?
HelpDialog.faq1APart2: section and use the violators filter. You can select one or more violators from the list. The system will automatically filter threats associated with the selected violators.
HelpDialog.faq1A: Go to the "Threat Analysis" section and use the violators filter. You can select one or more violators from the list. The system will automatically filter threats associated with the selected violators.
HelpDialog.faq2Q: What does the CIA triad mean and how is it used?
HelpDialog.faq2A: The CIA triad is an information security model consisting of three aspects:
HelpDialog.faq2APart2: Each threat can affect one or more aspects of the triad. You can filter threats by these aspects in the
HelpDialog.faq3Q: How are protection measures and threats related?
HelpDialog.faq3APart1: Each protection measure is aimed at countering specific threats. In the system, you can view which threats are associated with a specific protection measure, and vice versa — which protection measures are recommended to counter a specific threat. This information is available on the detail pages of
HelpDialog.faq3A: Each protection measure is aimed at countering specific threats. In the system, you can view which threats are associated with a specific protection measure, and vice versa — which protection measures are recommended to counter a specific threat.
HelpDialog.faq4Q: What are MITRE ATT&CK tactical tasks?
HelpDialog.faq4APart1: is a knowledge base of tactics and techniques used in cyberattacks by violators. Tactical tasks in this model describe specific actions that attackers can perform. In the system, each threat can be associated with one or more tactical tasks, which helps better understand the nature of the threat and ways to implement it. Learn more about tactical tasks in the
HelpDialog.faq4A: MITRE ATT&CK is a knowledge base of tactics and techniques used in cyberattacks by violators. Tactical tasks in this model describe specific actions that attackers can perform.
HelpDialog.faq5Q: Can data be exported from the system?
HelpDialog.faq5APart1: Yes, the system implements data export in various formats. On the
HelpDialog.faq5APart2: page, you can export filtered results in JSON, CSV, TSV, and TXT formats. On the detail pages of
HelpDialog.faq5APart3: you can also export data about individual threats in the same formats. Use the
HelpDialog.faq5A: Yes, the system implements data export in various formats. On the "Threat Analysis" page, you can export filtered results in JSON, CSV, TSV, and TXT formats.
HelpDialog.faq6Q: How often is data updated in the system?
HelpDialog.faq6A: Data in the system is based on official sources from FSTEC Russia and MITRE ATT&CK. Threat database updates occur as new versions of regulatory documents are published.
HelpDialog.faq7Q: Can multiple filters be combined simultaneously?
HelpDialog.faq7APart2: section you can apply multiple filters simultaneously. For example, you can select a specific violator, impact object, and CIA triad aspects. The system will show only threats that match all selected criteria.
HelpDialog.faq7A: Yes, in the "Threat Analysis" section you can apply multiple filters simultaneously. For example, you can select a specific violator, impact object, and CIA triad aspects.
HelpDialog.faq8Q: Where can I find official FSTEC documents?
HelpDialog.faq8APart1: Official FSTEC Russia documents are available on the
HelpDialog.faq8APart3: is also available for download directly from the system — the link to it is on the home page in the
HelpDialog.faq8A: Official FSTEC Russia documents are available on the fstec.ru website. FSTEC Order №17 is also available for download directly from the system.
HelpDialog.clickableData: All data in the system is clickable — you can navigate to detailed information about threats, protection measures, and tactical tasks.
HelpDialog.dataActuality: Data is current as of the last threat database update
HelpDialog.faq2AConfidentiality: Confidentiality (Confidentiality) — protection from unauthorized access to information
HelpDialog.faq2AIntegrity: Integrity (Integrity) — protection from unauthorized modification of information
HelpDialog.faq2AAvailability: Availability (Availability) — ensuring access to information when needed
